user.title: Device Pulse Setup
user.description:
**How would you like to set up monitoring?** 

- **Use Existing Integration**: Monitor devices from an integration you’ve already configured.
- **Create Manual Group**: Set up a new group and add devices manually.

integration_choice.title: Select Integration
integration_choice.description: **Choose which integration you want to monitor.** Only integrations with valid device information will be listed.

integration_device_selection_mode.title: Device Selection Mode
integration_device_selection_mode.description: Choose which devices from **{integration_name}** should be monitored.

integration_select_excluded_devices.title: Device Selection
integration_select_excluded_devices.description: **Pick the devices you don’t want to monitor** for integration **{integration_name}**. All other valid devices will be included automatically.

integration_select_included_devices.title: Device Selection
integration_select_included_devices.description: **Pick the devices you want to monitor** for integration **{integration_name}**. Only these devices will be included.

integration_summary.title: Configuration Summary

custom_group_info.title: Create Devices Group
custom_group_info.description: Enter a name for the new devices group. You’ll be able to add devices to this group in the next step.

data_description.group_name: The name that will identify this monitoring group.

custom_group_add_device.title: Add Device to Group
custom_group_add_device.description: Add a new device to this group by specifying its name and host. The host must be a valid hostname or IP address.

data_description.group_device_name: A friendly name to identify the device.
data_description.group_device_host: The hostname or IP address of the device to monitor.

custom_group_add_device_or_continue.title: Add a New Devices or Continue
custom_group_add_device_or_continue.description: Choose whether you want to add another device or continue to next steps.

custom_group_summary.title: Group Summary

monitor_parameters.title: Ping Parameters
monitor_parameters.description: **Set the rules for how devices are monitored through ping.** Define how many failed pings are needed before a device is considered offline, and how often each device should be pinged.

data_description.ping_attempts_before_failure: Number of consecutive failed pings before considering the device offline

monitor_sensors.title: Optional Sensors Configuration
monitor_sensors.description: You can enable additional sensors to get more detailed monitoring information. Choose which optional sensors you want to create.

data_description.sensors_integration_summary_enabled: Create summary sensors for {subject} group, showing the number of monitored devices and the number of offline devices
data_description.sensors_failed_pings_enabled: Create a sensor that shows the number of consecutive failed pings for each device.
data_description.sensors_disconnected_since_enabled: Create a sensor that records the time when a device went offline.
data_description.sensors_last_response_time_enabled: Create a sensor that shows the response time of the last successful ping.

custom_group_edit_action.description: Choose what you want to modify in this group. You can manage devices or adjust the monitoring settings.

custom_group_add_device.description: Add a new device to this group by specifying its name and host. The host must be a valid hostname or IP address.

data_description.group_device_name: A friendly name to identify the device.

custom_group_remove_devices.title: Remove Devices
custom_group_remove_devices.description: Select the devices you want to remove from this group. Once confirmed, the device will no longer be monitored.

custom_group_update_device_selection.title: Select Device to Edit
custom_group_update_device_selection.description: Choose the device you want to edit. You’ll be able to update its parameters in the next step.

custom_group_update_device_data.title: Edit Device Parameters
custom_group_update_device_data.description: Update the details of the device **{device_name}**. You can change settings used for monitoring.
